ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] New songs!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Comments below... ... From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)  To:  Sent: Wednesday, April 12, 2000 10:04 AM
ygData.messageBody:
Comments below...

----- Original Message -----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas) <garramone@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 12, 2000 10:04 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] New songs!!!


> the provocation song just pisses me off to no extent.

Heh, guess they succeeded <eg> ?

> since when does a
> bard have to target a fellow player to get the effect of their song?
also,
> the player does not have to be grouped with the bard. AND the song only
> lasts one pulse

Locating song and Charillion songs fit this model. None of the buff songs
do. (I hate to do this but I will...) It's like they were gonna give us
Bind Affinity or some sort of special purpose but then at the last moment
backed off and said: "oh hell, give them some kinda half-ass buff, maybe a
rune, toss in some str/agi/or dex and a bit of speed - that should keep them
happy..."

> , you have to refresh it like chain or bellow. this song is
> so completely un-bardlike. another wasted slot in our spellbook as far as
i
> can tell.

Another one of GZ's own 'good ideas' ??? Certainly not something that
someone who actually plays a bard (or even in groups with bards at levels 45
and up) would have thought of. Unless they think that it is something a
bard can use to increase a warrior or other player's taunt to direct a mob's
agression (away from the bard or current fenzy victim)?

Sylly
